text: believe it or not the Maldives has more
to offer than just resort fancy buffets
and scuba diving there are more than
400,000 locals living on roughly 200 of
the 12 hundred total islands in the
Indian Ocean their language of diva he
is similar to Sinhalese of Sri Lanka and
has the coolest-looking script I've ever
seen if that doesn't sound interesting
enough here are five things you probably
didn't know about the Maldives number
one it's flat
the Maldives is both the lowest and
flattest country on earth the average
height is 411 or 9 inches shorter than
me and the highest point is 7-7 above
sea level the height of Yao Ming that
puts the Maldives at a very high risk of
becoming extinct it's ocean levels keep
rising as 99 percent of the country is
water number 2 its Muslim the Maldives
is a smallest Muslim country in the
world and they strictly follow all rules
and traditions if you come here as a
tourist you must be respectful of their
religion right now it's Ramadan where
they're fast from sunrise to sunset for
a month as you can see most stores and
restaurants are closed it's
disrespectful to eat in front of locals
so don't do it
number three it's safe if you're coming
here as a tourist
then you'll likely be staying at one of
the hundred private resort islands the
fact that they are so isolated makes
them extremely safe crime on these
resort islands is virtually unheard of
you can leave your door unlocked and
your expensive electronics outside
unattended number four literacy rate is
high I was pleasantly surprised to hear
that the literacy rate among Maldivian
adults is 98% compare that to 86% in the
States since 1978 UNICEF has helped the
Maldives establish a unified education
system for children where they installed
a resource centres and schools with
strong internet to enable long-distance
teaching among different Islands how old
are you 9 as a result 99% of children
are enrolled in primary schools and the
graduation rate is also 99% that's
impressive number 5 it's a melting pot
over the centuries the Maldivian 's have
been influenced by Indians Sri Lankans
North Africans Arabs and Europeans who
separately traveled through the trade
routes of the Indian Ocean
but in
adapting one of their languages the
Maldives has developed their own unique
language and cultural identity their
religion however was converted to Islam
in 1153 ad I haven't even touched on the
natural beauty of the waters because I
feel like it could give in this water
color is so turquoise that it looks fake
and it's common to see sea life like
white tip shark swimming by the shore
it's truly been an incredible week here
in the Maldives and I can't wait to come
back again when it's sunny but as for
now the real adventure is about to begin
tomorrow where I'll see you in Iran
I'm drew pinsky and if you like my
travel videos please click Subscribe and
join me as I plan to visit every country
in the world
